courses.title: React for Beginers
courses.description: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces, especially single-page applications (SPAs). It was developed by Facebook and is maintained by Meta and the open-source community.

lessons.title: What is React?
lessons.description: Introduction to React and its purpose in building user interfaces.

lessons.title: Setting up React using Vite
lessons.description: Learn how to create a React project quickly using Vite.

lessons.title: JSX Syntax
lessons.description: Understanding how JSX allows HTML to be written within JavaScript.

lessons.title: Functional vs Class Components
lessons.description: Comparison of functional and class components in React.

lessons.title: Rendering Elements
lessons.description: Learn how React renders elements to the DOM.

lessons.title: React Fragments
lessons.description: Using React Fragments to group elements without extra DOM nodes.

lessons.title: Props in React
lessons.description: Passing data between components using props.

lessons.title: Handling Events
lessons.description: Attaching event handlers to elements in React.

lessons.title: Conditional Rendering
lessons.description: Show or hide content based on conditions.

lessons.title: Lists and Keys
lessons.description: Rendering lists of items and using keys for optimal performance.

lessons.title: Forms and Input Handling
lessons.description: Creating forms and managing user input.

lessons.title: useEffect Hook
lessons.description: Using useEffect to handle side effects in functional components.

lessons.title: Component Lifecycle
lessons.description: Understanding the lifecycle methods of components.

lessons.title: Basic Styling in React (Inline, CSS Modules, Tailwind)
lessons.description: Different ways to style React components.

courses.title: JavaScript
courses.description: JavaScript is a high-level, interpreted programming language that is one of the core technologies of the web, alongside HTML and CSS. It is a versatile, lightweight, and powerful language used to make web pages interactive, control browser behavior, and manipulate the DOM (Document Object Model).

courses.title: Python For Beginner
courses.description: Python is a high-level, interpreted, general-purpose programming language known for its simplicity, readability, and versatility. It was created by Guido van Rossum and first released in 1991. Python emphasizes code readability using clear and concise syntax, making it an excellent choice for beginners and experts alike.
